Description.Data: Use Line of Action to practice figure and pose drawing for 10 minutes

Tips.text: Be sure to actually DO this excersice! You need to get good, you won't be able to make anything pretty if you slack off on figure drawing! Remember, it's not as crucual to get anatomy right, as much as getting the *figure* right. Get the flow of the character, not her pefect anatomy. Then, if you have the time, get the basic shapes down.

Description.Data: Pick a bunch of Geometrical Shapes and Draw them in 4 different perspectives each

Tips.text: Be sure to actually DO this excersice! You need to get good, you won't be able to make anything pretty if you slack off on figure drawing! Remember, it's not as crucual to get anatomy right, as much as getting the *figure* right. Get the flow of the character, not her pefect anatomy. Then, if you have the time, get the basic shapes down.

Description.Data: Do the previous Homework Assignment from Proko's course again for good measure

Tips.text: Get as much practice as you can with this. You need to make sure you remember and internalize this stuff if you wanna get any better.

Description.Data: Go over the next lesson in Proko's Anatomy Tutorial and do the assignment given

Tips.text: Just watch one portion of the course at a time, don't overwhelm yourself. If need be watch them once a week.

Description.Data: Draw one of following body parts: Spine, Hips, Ribcage, Shoulders, Arm, Leg, hand, Basic Head, Face details, hands, feet, Tits, Dick, Ass, Pussy

Tips.text: Mix it up each day. Take a body part and draw it in several perspectives and angles, trying to get the perspective right for it. Start with the basic shapes and refine them further.

Description.Data: Draw a basic shape and try to draw water/any other liquid flowing on it

Tips.text: Remember to use real life examples as well as online ones! Also look up porn, why don't you. You have water around you, as well as... Other liquids, *use* it!

Description.Data: Draw clothes. Practice folds, thick/thin clothing, and bends

Tips.text: Remember to use real life examples, as well as online ones! Look yourself in the mirror, and *study* how the folds work. Take a sketchbook with you and try to sketch in front of a mirror.

Description.Data: Draw basic shapes and choose a lightsource, and then try to shade according to that light source.

Tips.text: Look up Tutorials and look at real life! Also, try and use new techniques for shadig, that Pyrrha experiment was good, now make it *better*
